content.description: The molecular structures of linoleic acid and palmitic acid, two naturally occurring substances, are shown in the figure.
content.question: Based on the molecular structures shown in the figure, which molecule is likely to be solid at room temperature?

choices.label: Linoleic acid, because the absence of carbon-carbon double bonds allows the molecules to pack closely together.
Linoleic acid, because the presence of carbon-carbon double bonds prevents the molecules from packing closely together.
Palmitic acid, because the absence of carbon-carbon double bonds allows the molecules to pack closely together.
Palmitic acid, because the presence of carbon-carbon double bonds prevents the molecules from packing closely together.

content.answer: Palmitic acid, because the absence of carbon-carbon double bonds allows the molecules to pack closely together.
